unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Interpretation of Slope $t$-Interval: Height, Weight
question_text: A statistician wanted to construct a $95\%$ confidence interval for the population slope between height (in inches) and weight (in pounds) of his co-workers. He made height the explanatory (independent) variable and weight the response (dependent) variable. He selected a random sample of $30$ people from work and asked them to list their height and weight. After seeing his conditions were satisfied, he constructed the interval and got a result of $(1.97, 2.89)$ . Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the interval in the context of this study?

choices.text: 95 % 95 % of the time the population slope relating height to weight for the statistician's co-workers will be in the interval from 1.97 1.97 to 2.89 2.89 .
The statistician is 95 % 95 % confident that for each additional increase in pounds, the average height will increase between 1.97 1.97 to 2.89 2.89 inches.
The statistician is 95 % 95 % confident that for each additional increase in pounds, the height will increase between 1.97 1.97 to 2.89 2.89 inches
The statistician is 95 % 95 % confident that the interval from 1.97 1.97 to 2.89 2.89 captures the sample slope for relating height to weight of his co-workers.
The statistician is 95 % 95 % confident that the interval from 1.97 1.97 to 2.89 2.89 captures the population slope for relating height to weight for his co-workers.
